benchmark_details.name: Uni-NLX
benchmark_details.overview: Uni-NLX is a unified framework that consolidates all Natural Language Explanations (NLE) tasks into a single and compact multi-task model using a unified training objective of text generation. It introduces two new NLE datasets: ImageNetX for explaining ImageNet categories and VQA-ParaX for explaining the Visual Question Answering task.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a unified model that performs multiple NLE tasks simultaneously and reduces the need for separate models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The model may exhibit shortcut learning in certain tasks, leading to explanations that repeat elements of the questions.

data.source: Datasets created using Large Language Models and existing NLE sample collections.
data.annotation: Automatically generated using prompts for LLMs.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the generated outputs when evaluated against a set of reference answers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better generation quality compared to benchmarks.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance compared to existing models like NLX-GPT.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using both filtered and unfiltered scores.
